arm_group.description: Single subcutaneous injection of PE0139, 40 mg/mL
Single subcutaneous injection of 0.9% Sodium Chloride (NaCl) (Placebo)

brief_summary.textblock:
This study is a first-in-human randomized, double-blind (Investigator and subject), placebo
      controlled single ascending dose study that will enroll approximately 40 (6 active/2 placebo
      per dose group) adult male and female subjects with Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus (T2DM).

clinical_study.brief_title: Phase 1 Multicenter, Single Ascending Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Response of PE0139 Injection in Adult Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus
clinical_study.official_title: Phase 1 Multicenter, Randomized, Double-Blind, Placebo Controlled, Single Ascending Dose Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetic and Pharmacodynamic Response of PE0139 Injection in Adult Subjects With Type 2 Diabetes Mellitus

oversight_info.authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.description: Safety will be evaluated by analyses of the change from baseline in vital signs.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in Vital Signs from baseline (Day 0 Pre-dose)

primary_outcome.description: Safety will be evaluated by analyses of the change from baseline in 12-lead ECG.
Safety will be evaluated by analyses of the safety laboratory parameters.
primary_outcome.measure: Change in Safety Labs from baseline (Pre-dose)

primary_outcome.description: Safety will be evaluated by the incidence and severity of immunogenicity.
Safety will be evaluated by the incidence and severity of adverse events including hypoglycemia.
primary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events including hypoglycemia

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic parameters include: Area under the concentration curve from time 0 to infinity (AUC(0-inf)), Area under the concentration curve to the final sample with a concentration greater than or equal to Limit of Quantitation (LOQ) (AUC(0-t)), Time to maximum concentration (Tmax), Maximum serum concentration (Cmax), Elimination rate constant (Lambda-z), Elimination half-life (t1/2), Clearance uncorrected for bioavailability (CL/F), Distribution uncorrected for bioavailability (Vz/F)

To assess the pharmacodynamic response (time action profile) of various single doses of PE0139.  Assessments include Fasting plasma glucose (FPG), 4-point serial glucose monitoring and glucose assessed by continuous glucose monitoring (CGM).
secondary_outcome.time_frame: FPG Day -10, -4, 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, and 28; 4-pt Glucose and CGM - Day -10 to -7, -6, -5, and -4 to 7

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Safety Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Caregiver, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
